Description: Laureate headed bust of Hadrian, right, draped on left shoulder. (obverse)
Aegyptos, draped, reclining left, holding sistrum in right hand, left arm resting on column, to left ibis. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Curator's comments: Barbarous in style with inappropriate obverse legend, the thin spread flan is odd for a purportedly late Hadrianic piece.
Bibliographic references: RE3 / Coins of the Roman Empire in the British Museum, vol.III: Nerva to Hadrian (1693 note, p.504)
Strack (Hadrian) / Die Reichspraegung zur Zeit des Hadrian (-) (barbarous copy?)
RIC2 / The Roman imperial coinage, vol. 2: Vespasian to Hadrian (838, p.445)
RIC2.3 / The Roman Imperial Coinage, vol. II - part 3 from AD 117-138 Hadrian (1592fn)
